an9.63:0.3: 63. Weaknesses in Training and Mindfulness Meditation
an9.63:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these five weaknesses when you’re training.
an9.63:1.3: Killing living creatures, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, and using alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
an9.63:1.4: These are the five weaknesses when you’re training.
an9.63:2.1: To give up these five weaknesses in your training you should develop the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
an9.63:2.3: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
an9.63:2.4: They meditate observing an aspect of feelings …
an9.63:2.5: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind …
an9.63:2.6: They meditate observing an aspect of principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
an9.63:2.7: To give up those five weaknesses in your training you should develop these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”
